Pre-Game Insights: The upcoming Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) match between Egypt and Ghana promises to be a highly anticipated encounter.
Set to take place on January 18, 2024, at 9:00 PM WAT, the match will be hosted at the Felix Houphouet Boigny Stadium in Abidjan, Ivory Coast.
Both Egypt and Ghana had less-than-ideal starts in their AFCON campaigns. Egypt managed a narrow escape from defeat against Mozambique, securing a point with a late penalty from Mohamed Salah.
Ghana suffered a 2-1 loss to Cape Verde after conceding a late goal by Garry Rodrigues in the 92nd minute.
Egypt's lineup is expected to include key players like Mohamed Salah, Trezeguet, and Elneny.

For Ghana, Mohammed Kudus is a player to watch, bringing creativity and goal-scoring ability to the team. The return of Kudus, who missed the opening match due to an injury, is a significant boost for Ghana.
Egypt's recent form has been relatively stable with a draw and three wins in their last five matches across all competitions.
Ghana has been struggling with only one win in their last six matches.
Historically, Egypt has had the upper hand in matches against Ghana, winning 12 out of 23 encounters.

Egypt has had to manage without players like Osama Galal and Ahmed Nabil Koita due to pre-tournament injuries, and there's also a concern over Mohamad Hany who was substituted in their opener against Mozambique due to an injury.
Ghana has a fully fit squad with no new major injury concerns. They are expected to include Inaki Williams and Andre Ayew in their starting lineup.
